story:
Basilea

the Swiss Handmade Shoe 

Hi! My name's Yves, and I'm a certified Swiss shoemaker. My greatest passion is handmade shoes and their production. I'm owner of the Fusswerk Manufactory, and at the time, I'm mostly making custom-tailored shoes.

My goal is to make handmade, Swiss quality shoes, at a fair price. But for that, I'll need your support!

 

Why buy swiss shoes?

 Switzerland isn't only known for great watches and good chocolate. Swiss artisanry is highly appreciated for it's high quality and precision. The same goes for Swiss Shoemaking.

As I've mentioned in the video, I want to stay true to the tradition of making your shoes by hand. The shoe's original design stems from the early 20th century. I brought that design up to date, and this is the result. You get to choose between a low or high cut shoe.


The Basilea

The shoe is composed of 100% leather, including the sole. Even the heel consists of the best, massive, layered leather.


As you can see, I've built in something extra. To make sure your new shoes are as lucky as can be, I work two swiss pennies into the heels. Also, the right shoe will receive a decent branding on its inner side. 

You'll get to pick from six different colours. Below, you'll see some leather samples. One half was treated with an antique finish, to give you an idea what your shoe will look like in the end. The hand applied finish turns out different every single time applied, so your shoes will be absolutely unique.

Keep in mind that the leather I use for these shoes has only received the absolute minimum in treatment, leaving it as pure as possible. Every hide used, tells the story of an animal. Even with the antique finish, the leather will change with wear. The use will brighten the leather, giving the shoes a distinct look that reflects your history with them. Don't want that? You'll find shoe polish in my E-shop (swiss made, of course) to nurture the leather and darken it again.

Please keep in mind that leather is a natural, and therefore sensitive material. The leather is NOT waterproof and should be treated accordingly. Each skin looks different. Scars in the leather, as well as different color tones, are possible and natural.

 

How will you get your shoes?

 

The official homepage and e-shop will go up, two months after the project's start. There, the low shoe will be available at 870$, and the high cut at 960$, both including shipping and the leathersole. The shop will also feature options for color and customization. Shoes will be available at industry standard sizes, going from US 8½ (EU 39) to 13½ (EU 46).
But to make sure your shoes really fit, you'll be able to print out a form and trace your foot measurements onto it. There will be a video guide to explain the process in detail.

 

The first shoes will presumably be shipped March 2013.

To keep up with this schedule, I depend on your funding. With your support, I'll be getting a grinder, a sole sewing machine, a branding iron, boxing and the required stock of fine leather.

 

I'm looking forward to making your shoes!

Cheers,
Yves

Cordial thanks to
Dana, my wife, for her great patience!

Mario

Daniel

Pascal

Fabio

Claus

Evelyne

Gilbert

Deniz
Walter
and everyone who supported me on my way to this point!

story:
DO YOU LOVE Warm, Soothing MASSAGE?

Me too.  I've been a Licensed Massage Practitioner for 17yrs now, and after 10 years my hands were not only exhausted, but they were starting to develop all sorts of aches and pains from overuse.  I needed a way to give great massages without using my fingers and thumbs to do all the work, and without losing that personal touch of a soothing massage.  I had an idea to design a series of solid stone tools that could be heated or cooled and that worked like extensions of your own hands and fingers, giving the feel of a real massage but with the "Synergy" of added radiant heat.

 

So I spent several years testing dozens of specialized shapes until I created 5 perfectly balanced works of funtional art called SYNERGY STONES!  Each SYNERGY STONE is contoured to fit comfortably against the body and in the hand, saving fingers and thumbs while giving an ultra-relaxing massage. For the next two years I practiced with them on friends, and on clients.  SYNERGY STONES were a big hit! And because they worked so well together, giving a "Synergy" of warmth, relaxation and healing therapy, I created a new style of Massage altogether...  The HEAT~WAVE!!

The HEAT~WAVE Massage is unlike any other massage.  It blends the Soothing Warm qualities of traditional Hot Stone massage with the therapeutic benefits of deeper bodywork.  The HEAT~WAVE's impressive and you have to experience it to believe it.  Until then check out our demo videos at www.YouTube.com! 

MASSAGE is IMPORTANT, VALUABLE and VITAL!

The impact that safe, healing MASSAGE has on people around the world, and on me, is why I became a massage practitioner in the first place. Massage is IMPORTANT. Massage feels great, sure. But it's more than that.  Contact in the form of Massage bridges the gap that so many people face these days... the lack of human touch that we want and need, but that we dont always get.  Countless studies have been done showing the VALUE of relaxing and therapeutic massage and the effect it has on people. Massage is VITAL and needed.  This is why I've dedicated myself to this project, to this vision and to sharing this new an amazing style of HEAT~WAVE Massage with the World!

HEADING the right DIRECTION...

My family and I launched SYNERGY STONE LLC this year with a homemade website, homemade videos, and tons of hard work.  Remember, these stone massage tools are made by hand, not by machine!  They are literally from our hands to yours and there's nothing else like them in the entire world.

YouTube has been a big help.  In a short time the HEAT~WAVE Massage has been discovered by Spas around the world.  From Brisbane AU, to Luxembourg, to Tranent UK, to Saudi Arabia, to Moneta VA. and back to Woodinville WA. just outside of Seattle.  And it's just the beginning!  Also, we're excited to announce that starting soon, we'll be offering hands-on workshops, web-cast training classes and DVD training programs to teach professionals and non-professionals the art of the New HEAT~WAVE Massage!  But with growth, comes new challenges...

We Need a Boost

The demand for our hand-made SYNERGY STONES is almost more than we can handle.  We need to jump the hurdle and go big.  Financial help from family is wonderful, but when a dream goes big, there are always unforseen expenses.  Now we need a Boost, in order to buy the equipment to ramp up production, hire an employee, finish the patent process, and in return, you'll get something wonderful!! 

Get a piece of the HEAT~WAVE Massage Revolution while you can!  Our SYNERGY STONE perks are worth their weight in GOLD, will last a lifetime and will make you or someone you love really happy.  Who doesn't love a Warm, Soothing Massage?!  And shipping is FREE, even international shipping for the bigger perks!  We just couldn't bare the thought of you having to pay for shipping to receive your Perks... No Way! (There are shipping charges for the smaller perks. Sorry!  No way around it..)

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you don't have a helping hand to give at the moment, we understand.  But you can still help out immensly!  Simply spreading the word can be more helpful than ever.  Share our campaign with the Indiegogo share tools and tell your friends about our great HEAT~WAVE Perks!  Thanks in advance for any help you're able to give!

story:
Hi Everyone!

I am exited to share that ETA Luxe has been invited to show at this year's Caribbean Fashion Week in Jamaica!!! I am very thankful and looking forward to showing my new Spring/Summer collection, but I am going to need your help. It costs $2000.00 to show and I need your support to make my dream come true! The money I raise will go towards all production costs associated with the show.

The ETA Luxe Brand has great plans for the future as well as being here for the long haul. By pledging you will help ETA Luxe get to the next level. Last year I was blessed to have shows in New York and Atlanta, and this year you all can help me add Jamaica to the list!!!

If you are unable to pledge, you can help in other ways by spreading the word on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook.

Thank you in advance and God bless.

Erica

Interested in the books listed in this campaign? Please visit our website at: http://www.darkregions.com


Update 06/10/2015: Campaign ends at 513% Funded and Unlocked a Total of 15 Stretch Goals. Grab Bags are still available for sale through this campaign page until July 1st for late customers, but no more stretch goals can be unlocked. Thank you all for your support!

Twelfth Stretch Goal Unlocked!

06/09/2015 - UNLOCKED: The Library of the Dead Edited by Michael Bailey Digital Copy Included in Every Grab Bag!

Eleventh Stretch Goal Unlocked!

06/09/2015 - UNLOCKED: Black Mercy Falls by Christopher Fulbright and Angeline Hawkes Digital Copy Included in Every Grab Bag!

Tenth Stretch Goal Unlocked!

06/09/2015 - UNLOCKED: Dark Regions Press will pay 5 to 10 of our published authors to write new original short stories of horror, fantasy and science fiction as a new digital anthology created for this campaign! Digital copies will be included in every grab bag and the book will not be released retail until at least 12 months after the new anthology is delivered to campaign backers.

Special Stretch Goal Unlocked!

06/09/2015 - UNLOCKED: The Engines of Sacrifice by James Chambers, a Collection of Lovecraftian Horror Novellas Digital Copy Included in Every Grab Bag!

Special Stretch Goal Unlocked!

06/09/2015 - UNLOCKED: Watchers: The Coming of the King, first book in a historical vampire trilogy by William Meikle Digital Copy will be included in every grab bag!

Eighth Stretch Goal Unlocked!

06/09/2015 - UNLOCKED: Dark Regions Press will hire award-winning artist Daniele Serra for a new color artwork piece made just for this campaign!

Special Stretch Goal Unlocked!

06/05/2015 - UNLOCKED: An ebook by bestselling author Sara Brooke will be included in every grab bag!

Seventh Stretch Goal Unlocked!

06/05/2015 - UNLOCKED: Black Labyrinth Book II: Prisoner 489 by Joe R. Lansdale illustrated by Santiago Caruso Digital Copy Included in Every Grab Bag!

05/29/2015 - UNLOCKED: Discoveries: Best of Horror and Dark Fantasy Edited by James R. Beach and Jason V. Brock Digital Copy Included in Every Grab Bag!

Second Stretch Goal Unlocked!

05/29/2015 - UNLOCKED: Clive Barker's The Midnight Meat Train Special Definitive Edition Digital Copy Included in Every Grab Bag!

First Stretch Goal Unlocked!

05/28/2015 - UNLOCKED: The First Ever Dark Regions Press Audiobook, Moon on the Water and Other Stories Written by Mort Castle Narrated by Multiple Professional Narrators Digital Copy Included in Every Grab Bag!

Campaign Goal Reached!

05/27/2015 - UNLOCKED: A Mountain Walked: Great Tales of the Cthulhu Mythos Edited by S. T. Joshi Digital Copy Included in Every Grab Bag!

Featuring stories by Neil Gaiman, Thomas Ligotti, Caitlín R. Kiernan, Michael Shea, Gemma Files, W. H. Pugmire and many more!


Four New Books Debut in The Ever-Expanding Grab Bag that Gets Better for Everyone as More People Order It and Saves Up to 75% Off Retail Price!

Dark Regions Press is an award-winning publisher of authors like Clive Barker, Joe R. Lansdale, Ramsey Campbell, Joyce Carol Oates and hundreds more and we're debuting four of our biggest titles of 2015 right here on Indiegogo including stories from Neil Gaiman, Ray Bradbury, William F. Nolan, Thomas Ligotti, Caitlín R. Kiernan, John Shirley and many more.

Here's how it works: each grab contains a minimum of three Dark Regions Press titles and up to as many as nine titles chosen at random except for those specified by name. Each grab bag is guaranteed to include a copy of our new release Like a Dead Man Walking by William F. Nolan (Logan's Run). If we reach our funding goal, A Mountain Walked: Great Tales of the Cthulhu Mythos edited by S. T. Joshi featuring stories by Neil Gaiman, Caitlín R. Kiernan and many more will be included in every grab bag. Then with every subsequent stretch goal unlocked The Ever-Expanding Grab Bag will continue to improve for everyone with additional titles, extras and more!


Clive Barker's The Body Book Announcement - Optional Add-Ons - Campaign Goals - How Does it Work? - Shipping Information - New Title Information - Grab Bag Items - About Dark Regions Press - Authors - Artists

Announcing Clive Barker's The Body Book Coming From Dark Regions Press in 2015

Dark Regions Press is extremely excited to announce the next release from world renowned imaginer Clive Barker and one of the biggest projects ever to be published by DRP: Clive Barker's The Body Book.

Including two of Clive Barker's classic stories from his groundbreaking collections Books of Blood, "The Body Politic" and "In the Flesh", exclusive content from the cinematic adaptation of "The Body Politic" and detailed information on the "In the Flesh" film that never came to be, The Body Book will have award-winning filmmaker Mick Garris (Quicksilver Highway, Masters of Horror, The Stand) joining forces with Clive Barker in an effort to bring fans never-before-seen photos, writings, interviews and much more.

(Mick Garris, Tobe Hooper, Stephen King and Clive Barker on the set of Sleepwalkers, 1992)

Clive Barker's The Body Book Will Be Available in Three Signed Limited Edition Hardcover Formats for Preorder Starting in Summer of 2015 for Backers of This Indiegogo Campaign and Dark Regions Press Collectors Club Members (Public Preorder in November 2015)

Clive Barker's The Body Book will also include paintings and artwork from Clive himself, and possibly (schedule permitting) a new original painting by Clive as the cover artwork created specifically for this project. 

Fans and collectors will be pleased to know that The Body Book will be offered in three signed limited edition hardcover formats, similar to those produced for Clive Barker's The Midnight Meat Train Special Definitive Edition. These limited edition hardcovers will have maximum print runs of 500 copies and will be the only signed limited edition copies ever printed of Clive Barker's The Body Book. 

Clive Barker's The Body Book is scheduled for a November 2015 public preorder on DarkRegions.com and is expected to sell out extremely fast. Backers of this Indiegogo campaign will get information on an early preorder for Clive Barker's The Body Book this summer before anyone else.

Stay tuned for more news on Clive Barker's The Body Book, and remember that backers of this Indiegogo campaign will get early preorder information before anyone else. Thank you for your interest and support!


Four New Titles from Dark Regions Press Debuting in This Indiegogo Campaign!

Like a Dead Man Walking by living literary legend, World Horror Society Grandmaster and co-author of Logan's Run William F. Nolan

A Mountain Walked: Great Tales of the Cthulhu Mythos edited by S. T. Joshi featuring stories by Neil Gaiman, Thomas Ligotti, Caitlín R. Kiernan, Michael Shea, Gemma Files and Many More

Moon on the Water and Other Stories Audiobook Written by Mort Castle with Multiple Professional Narrators

Discoveries: Best of Horror and Dark Fantasy Edited by James R. Beach and Jason V. Brock Featuring a rare story by literary legend Ray Bradbury, W.H. Pugmire, John Shirley, Tim Lebbon, John R. Little and Many More

Support the Production of Multiple New Projects Coming in 2015 from Dark Regions Press by Ordering Your Ever-Expanding Grab Bag Before this Indiegogo Campaign Ends on June 9th

Customers who support this Indiegogo campaign will be supporting the production of multiple projects coming in 2015 from Dark Regions Press, including those listed above. The Ever-Expanding Grab Bags will be shipping to customers by July 2015 and the grab bags ship to United States customers for free!
There are multiple reward levels besides just the grab bags, from custom artworks by some of our artists to short stories written by award-winning authors just for you, we've made sure to give our customers plenty of options to support this campaign and have some fun.

Thank you, and if you have any questions about this campaign please contact us at: darkregions.help@gmail.com. Find information on optional add-ons, stretch goals, authors, artists and more below.



To purchase an add-on click on the "CONTRIBUTE NOW" button at the top of the page. In the Contribute menu enter the amount for the add-on(s) that you wish to purchase then select "No perk, I Just want to contribute." After completing the process e-mail us at: darkregions.help@gmail.com with which add-ons you purchased with your contribution. The add-on(s) will then be included with your grab bag package.

Customers can order Optional Add-Ons without any Perk level (reward package) and United States shipping is free. International customers please add $12 in additional shipping charges per Add-On.

Mermaid by Daniele Serra created for Stretch Goal #8 of this campaign

This new color piece was created by award-winning artist Daniele Serra just two days before this campaign unlocked Stretch Goal #8. It's included as a digital file and wallpaper in every grab bag and is available here in signed prints and the original painting.

Signed Mermaid Artwork Print: $20

Original Mermaid Watercolor Painting: $1,000



Masters of the Weird Tale: David Case Signed and Numbered Hardcover - $250 ($100 off retail price)

The largest collection of David Case stories ever collected in one volume, including seventeen original, full-page artworks by Jason Zerrillo. Also included is a new introduction by Ramsey Campbell, with photographs of the author and images of old editions of his books.

The book itself has a full color wraparound dustjacket (the spine is designed so that it fits nicely with your existing Masters of the Weird Tale volumes), ribbon marker, cloth slipcase, and other extras. The edition is limited to 200 signed and numbered copies, and the book is signed by David Case, Jason Zerrillo, Ramsey Campbell, and editor S.T. Joshi.


Clive Barker's The Midnight Meat Train Special Definitive Edition Ultra-Deluxe Traycased PC Hardcover (Only ONE copy available) - $1000

Slated to be one of the finest productions ever by Dark Regions Press, this edition is limited to just 13 signed and lettered copies worldwide with 7 extra PC copies made for contributors. Each signature sheet contains a unique sketch by author Clive Barker, making each copy of this premium edition a unique collectors item.



Black Labyrinth Book II: Prisoner 489 by Joe R. Lansdale illustrated by Santiago Caruso Ultra-Deluxe Shadow Tome Traycased Hardcover - $600

One extra PC copy of the long sold out cowhide-bound traycased edition of Black Labyrinth Book II: Prisoner 489 by Joe R. Lansdale illustrated by Santiago Caruso is available in The Ever-Expanding Grab Bag Indiegogo campaign ending tonight, June 9th.

This edition is limited to thirteen signed and numbered copies worldwide, with seven copies made as extras for contributors/in case of damage. Every book in the Black Labyrinth imprint, a line of ten psychological horror novels and novellas by the living masters of horror and dark fiction illustrated by Santiago Caruso, will have its ultra deluxe edition limited to thirteen signed and numbered copies worldwide.​


World War Cthulhu: A Collection of Lovecraftian War Stories Deluxe Slipcased Hardcover $75 Off Retail Price - $125

Leather-bound Deluxe Hardcover of World War Cthulhu: A Collection of Lovecraftian War Stories signed by the editors and artist on special signature sheet. Front cover stamped with Cthulhu design in gold foil and housed in a red leatherette slipcase stamped with Cthulhu in gold. This Add-On is limited to 10 customers!

'Salem's Lot by Stephen King Deluxe Special Edition Slipcased Gift Hardcover - $85 (retail $95)

An oversized special edition of the classic novel 'Salem's Lot by Stephen King featuring an introduction by Stephen King, an afterword by Clive Barker, deleted scenes from the original manuscript, original artwork by David Palumbo and much more. Normally $95, offered here at a discounted rate of $85 per copy with free U.S. shipping included.

The Scarlet Gospels by Clive Barker Trade Hardcover - $25

The thrilling return of Clive Barker's classic character Pinhead in The Scarlet Gospels.

The Scarlet Gospels by Clive Barker UK Trade Hardcover w/ Unique Cover - $30

The thrilling return of Clive Barker's classic character Pinhead in The Scarlet Gospels UK edition.

A Mountain Walked: Great Tales of the Cthulhu Mythos Special Trade Paperback Signed by S. T. Joshi - $25

This special trade paperback edition of A Mountain Walked: Great Tales of the Cthulhu Mythos will feature a different cover than the retail version and will be signed by editor S. T. Joshi! Less than 100 copies of this special trade paperback edition will ever be printed and will not be offered for retail sale.

Discoveries: Best of Horror and Dark Fantasy Edited by James R. Beach and Jason V. Brock Special Signed Trade Paperback - $25

A special advance trade paperback copy of Discoveries: Best of Horror and Dark Fantasy signed by editors James R. Beach and Jason V. Brock.

Like a Dead Man Walking by William F. Nolan Special Signed Trade Paperback - $25

The special signed trade paperback edition of Like a Dead Man Walking by William F. Nolan available as a standalone Add-On. Signed by author William F. Nolan and editor Jason V. Brock.

Original Watercolor Paintings for Sale by Award-Winning Artist Daniele Serra through The Ever-Expanding Grab Bag Campaign (click on paintings for larger versions):

Dreams from the Witch House Original Wraparound Cover Artwork - Watercolor - 12"x18" 
$2,000

Alien - Watercolor - 12"x18"
$2,000

Lonely - Watercolor - 12"x18"
$1,500

Pan's Labyrinth - Watercolor - 12"x18"
$2,000

Monsters - Watercolor - 12"x12"
$900

Deep Like the River Original Wraparound Cover Artwork - Watercolor - 12"x18"
$1,500


Shadows of the Evening - Watercolor - 12"x18"
$1,000 - Based on Story by Joyce Carol Oates within Dreams from the Witch House

Campaign Goal Reached!

UNLOCKED: A Mountain Walked: Great Tales of the Cthulhu Mythos Edited by S. T. Joshi Included in Every Grab Bag!

First Stretch Goal Unlocked!

UNLOCKED: The First Ever Dark Regions Press Audiobook, Moon on the Water and Other Stories Written by Mort Castle Included in Every Grab Bag!


Second Stretch Goal Unlocked!

Like a Dead Man Walking by William F. Nolan

The critically-acclaimed collection Like a Dead Man Walking by living literary legend, World Horror Society Grandmaster and co-author of Logan's Run William F. Nolan was previously only offered in a pricey signed limited hardcover edition format, but Dark Regions Press is publishing the ebook and trade paperback editions this summer including an all-new story, "A Conversation With the Dark Guy." Ebook/Trade Paperbacks are included in every Ever-Expanding Grab Bag!

Working with editor Jason V Brock (Milton’s Children), Nolan brings to shocking life not only debauched murderers and depraved loners, but also fascinating portraits of personal reflection; the heroes of yore in poetry; pages from Nolan’s notebook; and an exclusive, intimate interview with his beloved friend, the late Richard Matheson (I Am Legend).


A Mountain Walked: Great Tales of the Cthulhu Mythos Edited by S. T. Joshi

One of the most highly demanded Lovecraftian and weird fiction anthologies of 2014, A Mountain Walked: Great Tales of the Cthulhu Mythos is edited by world renowned Lovecraft scholar S. T. Joshi and features stories by Neil Gaiman, Caitlín R. Kiernan, Michael Shea, Gemma Files and many more accompanied by the stunning artwork of David Ho.

Previously only offered in a very expensive signed limited edition hardcover format that is now extremely hard to find, Dark Regions Press is publishing the ebook and trade paperback editions of A Mountain Walked and debuting them here in the Ever-Expanding Grab Bag campaign (if our campaign goal is reached).


Moon on the Water and Other Stories Audiobook Written by Mort Castle

We are incredibly excited to be publishing the very first Dark Regions Press audiobook. With stories written by award-winning author Mort Castle and narrated by several talented professional narrators, customers will be delighted at the quality of this audiobook and the deft writing of the stories by the one and only Mort Castle. A digital copy of this audiobook will be included in every grab bag if our first stretch goal is reached.

Discoveries: Best of Horror and Dark Fantasy edited by James R. Beach and Jason V. Brock

This anthology is going to be a big one: featuring a rare story by Ray Bradbury and stories by W.H. Pugmire, John Shirley, Tim Lebbon, John R. Little and many more, this anthology is slated for retail release later this year. Customers who join us in The Ever-Expanding Grab Bag will be receiving a digital copy of this anthology if our third stretch goal is unlocked!

Dark Regions Press is an independent specialty publisher of horror, dark fiction, fantasy and science fiction, specializing in horror and dark fiction in business since 1985. We have gained recognition around the world for our creative works in genre fiction and poetry.  We were awarded the Horror Writers Association 2010 Specialty Press Award and the Italian 2012 Black Spot award for Excellence in a Foreign Publisher. We produce premium signed hardcover editions for collectors as well as quality trade paperbacks and ebook editions.  Our books have received seven Bram Stoker Awards from the Horror Writers Association.

We have published hundreds of authors, artists and poets such as Clive Barker, Joe R. Lansdale, Ramsey Campbell, Kevin J. Anderson, Bentley Little, Michael D. Resnick, Rick Hautala, Bruce Boston, Robert Frazier, W.H. Pugmire, Simon Strantzas, Jeffrey Thomas, Charlee Jacob, Richard Gavin, Tim Waggoner and hundreds more.  Dark Regions Press has been creating specialty books and creative projects for over twenty-nine years.

The press has staff throughout the United States working virtually but also has a localized office in Portland, Oregon from where we ship our orders and maintain the primary components of the business.

Dark Regions Press staff, authors, artists and products have appeared in FANGORIA Magazine, Rue Morgue Magazine, Cemetery Dance Magazine, Dark Discoveries Magazine, Publishers Weekly, Kirkus Reviews, Booklist Online, LA Times, The Sunday Chicago Tribune, The Examiner, Playboy, Comic-Con, Wired, The Huffington Post, Horror World, Barnes & Noble, Amazon, iBooks, Sony Reader store and many other publications and vendors.


Dark Regions Press published authors that are participating in custom short stories and name insertion reward levels.

Angeline Hawkes
Angeline Hawkes holds a B.A. in Composite English Language Arts and Secondary Education from Texas A&M University-Commerce. Angeline's collection, The Commandments, was a 2006 Bram Stoker Award finalist. Her story, "In Waters Black the Lost Ones Sleep", appears in the Origins award-nominated Chaosium anthology, Frontier Cthulhu. Angeline works or has worked for such publishers as Delirium Books, Chaosium, Elder Signs Press, Dark Regions Press, DarkFuse and many others. She has seen the publication of novels, novellas, collections, fiction in 40+ anthologies, and over 100 short fiction publications. She is formerly an active member of HWA and a former member of the Robert E. Howard UPA. Angeline often writes collaboratively with her husband, Christopher Fulbright. Visit her websites at www.angelinehawkes.com and www.fulbrightandhawkes.com.

Tim Waggoner
Tim Waggoner has published over thirty novels and three short story collections, and his articles on writing have appeared in Writer’s Digest and Writers’ Journal, among others. He teaches creative writing at Sinclair Community College and in Seton Hill University’s Master of Fine Arts in Writing Popular Fiction program. Visit him on the web at www.timwaggoner.com

Shane McKenzie

Shane McKenzie is the author of Infinity House, All You Can Eat, Bleed on Me, Jacked, Addicted to the Dead, Muerte Con Carne, Escape from Shit Town (co-authored with Sam W. Anderson and Erik Williams), Fat Off Sex and Violence, Pus Junkies, Stork, Fairy, The Bingo Hall, Parasite Deep, and many more to come. 

He also writes comics for Zenescope Entertainment. 

He wrote the script for a short film entitled M is for Matador, filmed by LuchaGore Productions, which was selected by DraftHouse Films to be included in the DVD The ABCs of Death 1.5. LuchaGore Productions will be filming a short film based on the first chapter of his novel Muerte Con Carne, entitled El Gigante. He lives in Austin, TX with his wife and daughter. 

He will find you and he will cut you.

www.shanemckenzie.org


William Meikle
William Meikle is a Scottish writer with over a dozen novels published in the genre press and over 200 short story credits in thirteen countries. He is the author of the ongoing Midnight Eye series among others, and his work appears in a number of professional anthologies. His ebook THE INVASION has been as high as #2 in the Kindle SF charts. He lives in a remote corner of Newfoundland with icebergs, whales and bald eagles for company. In the winters he gets warm vicariously through the lives of others in cyberspace, so please check him out at http://www.williammeikle.com

James Chambers
James Chambers is the author of numerous tales of horror, dark fantasy, and science fiction, which have been published in more than 20 anthologies and magazines, including Bare Bone, Bad-Ass Faeries, the award-winning Bad-Ass Faeries 2: Just Plain Bad, Breach the Hull, Crypto-Critters (Vol. 1 & 2), Cthulhu Sex, Dark Furies, The Dead Walk, The Domino Lady: Sex as a Weapon, Hardboiled Cthulhu, Hear Them Roar, Allen K’s Inhuman, Lin Carter’s Anton Zarnak: Supernatural Sleuth, Lost Worlds of Space and Time (Vol. 1), No Longer Dreams, Sick: An Anthology of Illness, So It Begins, Warfear, and Weird Trails. His wrote the collection The Midnight Hour: Saint Lawn Hill and Other Tales in collaboration with illustrator Jason Whitley. He has also written numerous comic books, including Leonard Nimoy’s Primortals and “The Revenant” in Shadow House, and edited the graphic novel adaptation of From Dusk Till Dawn. He lives in New York and can be found online at www.jameschambersonline.com.

Stephen Mark Rainey
Stephen Mark Rainey is author of the novels BALAK, THE LEBO COVEN, DARK SHADOWS: DREAMS OF THE DARK (with Elizabeth Massie), THE NIGHTMARE FRONTIER, and BLUE DEVIL ISLAND; over 90 published works of short fiction; five short-fiction collections, including OTHER GODS and THE GAKI & OTHER HUNGRY SPIRITS from Dark Regions; and several audio dramas for Big Finish Productions based on the Dark Shadows TV series, featuring several original cast members. For ten years, he edited the award-winning DEATHREALM magazine, and he has edited anthologies for Chaosium, Arkham House, and Delirium Books. He currently lives in Greensboro. Visit Mark's website at www.stephenmarkrainey.com


Dark Regions Press published artists that are participating in the custom illustration reward level.

Daniele Serra
Daniele Serra was born and lives in Italy. He works as illustrator and comic artist, his work has been published in Europe, Australia, United States and Japan. He has worked for Dark Regions Press, DC Comics, Image Comics, Cemetery Dance, Weird Tales magazine, PS Publishing and other publications. He is a winner of the British Fantasy Award. Visit him online at: http://www.multigrade.it

M. Wayne Miller
M. Wayne Miller has become a well-known name in the field of horror illustration. Not to be limited, Wayne is equally adept with science fiction, fantasy, and young adult themes, welcoming the opportunities of each genre and, frequently, combining them all. His list of clients has grown long indeed, and Wayne intends to continue his quest to learn and grow as an artist and illustrator. Visit him online at: http://mwaynemiller.com

Frank Walls
Visit Frank online at: http://frankwalls.net

Alex McVey
Alex McVey is an American fine artist and illustrator from Texas, mostly known for his work on high-end limited edition books and album art. He has illustrated the works of Stephen King, William Peter Blatty, Brian Keene, Joe R. Lansdale, and others. McVey is known for his work within the horror genre, and for his use of a variety of styles, subject matter, and media. Clients include: Cemetery Dance Publications, Bloodletting Press, Weird Tales, Straight Line Stitch, Centipede Press, Team Y&R, and others. Visit him online at: http://www.alexmcvey.com

Four New Books Debut in The Ever-Expanding Grab Bag that Gets Better for Everyone as More People Order It and Saves Up to 75% Off Retail Price!
Dark Regions Press is an award-winning publisher of authors like Clive Barker, Joe R. Lansdale, Ramsey Campbell, Joyce Carol Oates and hundreds more and we're debuting four of our biggest titles of 2015 right here on Indiegogo including stories from Neil Gaiman, Ray Bradbury, William F. Nolan, Thomas Ligotti, Caitlín R. Kiernan, John Shirley and many more.

Here's how it works: each grab contains a minimum of three Dark Regions Press titles and up to as many as nine titles chosen at random except for those specified by name. Each grab bag is guaranteed to include a copy of our new release Like a Dead Man Walking by William F. Nolan (Logan's Run). If we reach our funding goal, A Mountain Walked: Great Tales of the Cthulhu Mythos edited by S. T. Joshi featuring stories by Neil Gaiman, Caitlín R. Kiernan and many more will be included in every grab bag. Then with every subsequent stretch goal unlocked The Ever-Expanding Grab Bag will continue to improve for everyone with additional titles, extras and more!



Clive Barker's The Body Book Announcement - Optional Add-Ons - Campaign Goals - How Does it Work? - Shipping Information - New Title Information - Grab Bag Items - About Dark Regions Press - Authors - Artists



Announcing Clive Barker's The Body Book Coming From Dark Regions Press in 2015

Dark Regions Press is extremely excited to announce the next release from world renowned imaginer Clive Barker and one of the biggest projects ever to be published by DRP: Clive Barker's The Body Book.
Including two of Clive Barker's classic stories from his groundbreaking collections Books of Blood, "The Body Politic" and "In the Flesh", exclusive content from the cinematic adaptation of "The Body Politic" and detailed information on the "In the Flesh" film that never came to be, The Body Book will have award-winning filmmaker Mick Garris (Quicksilver Highway, Masters of Horror, The Stand) joining forces with Clive Barker in an effort to bring fans never-before-seen photos, writings, interviews and much more.
(Mick Garris, Tobe Hooper, Stephen King and Clive Barker on the set of Sleepwalkers, 1992)
Clive Barker's The Body Book Will Be Available in Three Signed Limited Edition Hardcover Formats for Preorder Starting in Summer of 2015 for Backers of This Indiegogo Campaign and Dark Regions Press Collectors Club Members (Public Preorder in November 2015)
Clive Barker's The Body Book will also include paintings and artwork from Clive himself, and possibly (schedule permitting) a new original painting by Clive as the cover artwork created specifically for this project. 
Fans and collectors will be pleased to know that The Body Book will be offered in three signed limited edition hardcover formats, similar to those produced for Clive Barker's The Midnight Meat Train Special Definitive Edition. These limited edition hardcovers will have maximum print runs of 500 copies and will be the only signed limited edition copies ever printed of Clive Barker's The Body Book. 
Clive Barker's The Body Book is scheduled for a November 2015 public preorder on DarkRegions.com and is expected to sell out extremely fast. Backers of this Indiegogo campaign will get information on an early preorder for Clive Barker's The Body Book this summer before anyone else.
Stay tuned for more news on Clive Barker's The Body Book, and remember that backers of this Indiegogo campaign will get early preorder information before anyone else. Thank you for your interest and support!

Masters of the Weird Tale: David Case Signed and Numbered Hardcover - $250 ($100 off retail price)
The largest collection of David Case stories ever collected in one volume, including seventeen original, full-page artworks by Jason Zerrillo. Also included is a new introduction by Ramsey Campbell, with photographs of the author and images of old editions of his books.
The book itself has a full color wraparound dustjacket (the spine is designed so that it fits nicely with your existing Masters of the Weird Tale volumes), ribbon marker, cloth slipcase, and other extras. The edition is limited to 200 signed and numbered copies, and the book is signed by David Case, Jason Zerrillo, Ramsey Campbell, and editor S.T. Joshi.

This edition is limited to thirteen signed and numbered copies worldwide, with seven copies made as extras for contributors/in case of damage. Nolan, for example, is guaranteed to be included in every grab bag). A full list of possible items in every grab bag can be found lower on this page.

Like a Dead Man Walking by William F. Nolan
The critically-acclaimed collection Like a Dead Man Walking by living literary legend, World Horror Society Grandmaster and co-author of Logan's Run William F. Nolan was previously only offered in a pricey signed limited hardcover edition format, but Dark Regions Press is publishing the ebook and trade paperback editions this summer including an all-new story, "A Conversation With the Dark Guy." Ebook/Trade Paperbacks are included in every Ever-Expanding Grab Bag!
Working with editor Jason V Brock (Milton’s Children), Nolan brings to shocking life not only debauched murderers and depraved loners, but also fascinating portraits of personal reflection; the heroes of yore in poetry; pages from Nolan’s notebook; and an exclusive, intimate interview with his beloved friend, the late Richard Matheson (I Am Legend).













A Mountain Walked: Great Tales of the Cthulhu Mythos Edited by S. T. Joshi
One of the most highly demanded Lovecraftian and weird fiction anthologies of 2014, A Mountain Walked: Great Tales of the Cthulhu Mythos is edited by world renowned Lovecraft scholar S. T. Joshi and features stories by Neil Gaiman, Caitlín R. Kiernan, Michael Shea, Gemma Files and many more accompanied by the stunning artwork of David Ho.
Previously only offered in a very expensive signed limited edition hardcover format that is now extremely hard to find, Dark Regions Press is publishing the ebook and trade paperback editions of A Mountain Walked and debuting them here in the Ever-Expanding Grab Bag campaign (if our campaign goal is reached).













Moon on the Water and Other Stories Audiobook Written by Mort Castle
We are incredibly excited to be publishing the very first Dark Regions Press audiobook. With stories written by award-winning author Mort Castle and narrated by several talented professional narrators, customers will be delighted at the quality of this audiobook and the deft writing of the stories by the one and only Mort Castle. A digital copy of this audiobook will be included in every grab bag if our first stretch goal is reached.













Discoveries: Best of Horror and Dark Fantasy edited by James R. Beach and Jason V. Brock
This anthology is going to be a big one: featuring a rare story by Ray Bradbury and stories by W.H. Pugmire, John Shirley, Tim Lebbon, John R. Little and many more, this anthology is slated for retail release later this year. Customers who join us in The Ever-Expanding Grab Bag will be receiving a digital copy of this anthology if our third stretch goal is unlocked!

Dark Regions Press is an independent specialty publisher of horror, dark fiction, fantasy and science fiction, specializing in horror and dark fiction in business since 1985. We have gained recognition around the world for our creative works in genre fiction and poetry.  We were awarded the Horror Writers Association 2010 Specialty Press Award and the Italian 2012 Black Spot award for Excellence in a Foreign Publisher. We produce premium signed hardcover editions for collectors as well as quality trade paperbacks and ebook editions.  Our books have received seven Bram Stoker Awards from the Horror Writers Association.
We have published hundreds of authors, artists and poets such as Clive Barker, Joe R. Lansdale, Ramsey Campbell, Kevin J. Anderson, Bentley Little, Michael D. Resnick, Rick Hautala, Bruce Boston, Robert Frazier, W.H. Pugmire, Simon Strantzas, Jeffrey Thomas, Charlee Jacob, Richard Gavin, Tim Waggoner and hundreds more.  Dark Regions Press has been creating specialty books and creative projects for over twenty-nine years.
The press has staff throughout the United States working virtually but also has a localized office in Portland, Oregon from where we ship our orders and maintain the primary components of the business.
Dark Regions Press staff, authors, artists and products have appeared in FANGORIA Magazine, Rue Morgue Magazine, Cemetery Dance Magazine, Dark Discoveries Magazine, Publishers Weekly, Kirkus Reviews, Booklist Online, LA Times, The Sunday Chicago Tribune, The Examiner, Playboy, Comic-Con, Wired, The Huffington Post, Horror World, Barnes & Noble, Amazon, iBooks, Sony Reader store and many other publications and vendors.


Dark Regions Press published authors that are participating in custom short stories and name insertion reward levels.

Angeline HawkesAngeline Hawkes holds a B.A. in Composite English Language Arts and Secondary Education from Texas A&M University-Commerce. Angeline's collection, The Commandments, was a 2006 Bram Stoker Award finalist. Her story, "In Waters Black the Lost Ones Sleep", appears in the Origins award-nominated Chaosium anthology, Frontier Cthulhu. Angeline works or has worked for such publishers as Delirium Books, Chaosium, Elder Signs Press, Dark Regions Press, DarkFuse and many others. She has seen the publication of novels, novellas, collections, fiction in 40+ anthologies, and over 100 short fiction publications. She is formerly an active member of HWA and a former member of the Robert E. Howard UPA. Angeline often writes collaboratively with her husband, Christopher Fulbright. Visit her websites at www.angelinehawkes.com and www.fulbrightandhawkes.com.


Tim WaggonerTim Waggoner has published over thirty novels and three short story collections, and his articles on writing have appeared in Writer’s Digest and Writers’ Journal, among others. He teaches creative writing at Sinclair Community College and in Seton Hill University’s Master of Fine Arts in Writing Popular Fiction program. Visit him on the web at www.timwaggoner.com


Shane McKenzie
Shane McKenzie is the author of Infinity House, All You Can Eat, Bleed on Me, Jacked, Addicted to the Dead, Muerte Con Carne, Escape from Shit Town (co-authored with Sam W. Anderson and Erik Williams), Fat Off Sex and Violence, Pus Junkies, Stork, Fairy, The Bingo Hall, Parasite Deep, and many more to come. 
He also writes comics for Zenescope Entertainment. 
He wrote the script for a short film entitled M is for Matador, filmed by LuchaGore Productions, which was selected by DraftHouse Films to be included in the DVD The ABCs of Death 1.5. LuchaGore Productions will be filming a short film based on the first chapter of his novel Muerte Con Carne, entitled El Gigante. He lives in Austin, TX with his wife and daughter. 
He will find you and he will cut you.
www.shanemckenzie.org

William MeikleWilliam Meikle is a Scottish writer with over a dozen novels published in the genre press and over 200 short story credits in thirteen countries. He is the author of the ongoing Midnight Eye series among others, and his work appears in a number of professional anthologies. His ebook THE INVASION has been as high as #2 in the Kindle SF charts. He lives in a remote corner of Newfoundland with icebergs, whales and bald eagles for company. In the winters he gets warm vicariously through the lives of others in cyberspace, so please check him out at http://www.williammeikle.com
James ChambersJames Chambers is the author of numerous tales of horror, dark fantasy, and science fiction, which have been published in more than 20 anthologies and magazines, including Bare Bone, Bad-Ass Faeries, the award-winning Bad-Ass Faeries 2: Just Plain Bad, Breach the Hull, Crypto-Critters (Vol. 1 & 2), Cthulhu Sex, Dark Furies, The Dead Walk, The Domino Lady: Sex as a Weapon, Hardboiled Cthulhu, Hear Them Roar, Allen K’s Inhuman, Lin Carter’s Anton Zarnak: Supernatural Sleuth, Lost Worlds of Space and Time (Vol. 1), No Longer Dreams, Sick: An Anthology of Illness, So It Begins, Warfear, and Weird Trails. His wrote the collection The Midnight Hour: Saint Lawn Hill and Other Tales in collaboration with illustrator Jason Whitley. He has also written numerous comic books, including Leonard Nimoy’s Primortals and “The Revenant” in Shadow House, and edited the graphic novel adaptation of From Dusk Till Dawn. He lives in New York and can be found online at www.jameschambersonline.com.


Stephen Mark RaineyStephen Mark Rainey is author of the novels BALAK, THE LEBO COVEN, DARK SHADOWS: DREAMS OF THE DARK (with Elizabeth Massie), THE NIGHTMARE FRONTIER, and BLUE DEVIL ISLAND; over 90 published works of short fiction; five short-fiction collections, including OTHER GODS and THE GAKI & OTHER HUNGRY SPIRITS from Dark Regions; and several audio dramas for Big Finish Productions based on the Dark Shadows TV series, featuring several original cast members. For ten years, he edited the award-winning DEATHREALM magazine, and he has edited anthologies for Chaosium, Arkham House, and Delirium Books. He currently lives in Greensboro. Visit Mark's website at www.stephenmarkrainey.com

Dark Regions Press published artists that are participating in the custom illustration reward level.


Daniele SerraDaniele Serra was born and lives in Italy. He works as illustrator and comic artist, his work has been published in Europe, Australia, United States and Japan. He has worked for Dark Regions Press, DC Comics, Image Comics, Cemetery Dance, Weird Tales magazine, PS Publishing and other publications. He is a winner of the British Fantasy Award. Visit him online at: http://www.multigrade.it



M. Wayne Miller
M. Wayne Miller has become a well-known name in the field of horror illustration. Not to be limited, Wayne is equally adept with science fiction, fantasy, and young adult themes, welcoming the opportunities of each genre and, frequently, combining them all. His list of clients has grown long indeed, and Wayne intends to continue his quest to learn and grow as an artist and illustrator. Visit him online at: http://mwaynemiller.com


Frank Walls
Visit Frank online at: http://frankwalls.net


Alex McVey
Alex McVey is an American fine artist and illustrator from Texas, mostly known for his work on high-end limited edition books and album art. He has illustrated the works of Stephen King, William Peter Blatty, Brian Keene, Joe R. Lansdale, and others. McVey is known for his work within the horror genre, and for his use of a variety of styles, subject matter, and media. Clients include: Cemetery Dance Publications, Bloodletting Press, Weird Tales, Straight Line Stitch, Centipede Press, Team Y&R, and others. Visit him online at: http://www.alexmcvey.com

story:
The purpose of this campaign is to raise enough money for the first run of t-shirts, tank tops and caps of new american sportswear line. So if the goal is met this is basically a grand preorder event for the book, and as with other crowdfunding campaigns; if the goal isn't reached all the money will be refunded to everyone. In that case ROKN Apparel will have to stay in the dream status for a while and the world keeps on turning. But let's aim for the first run!

If you stumbled upon this campaign without knowing about ROKN Apparel beforehand, let me tell you a little about it. I started working on this line, because of a comic I'm creating. Yup, a comic. The comic is called SOLE CITY and it was created under my freelance graphics persona Rockin Dem Chucks Design. 


I started posting images of the characters and people fell in love with the characters and started choosing favorites. Soon the requests for t-shirts came and I have always loved fashion, particularly american sportswear (t-shirts, ball caps and such). RDCD ROKN actually came from my design name, Rockin Dem Chucks. I just took out the "C" and the "I" because I have a fascination with four letters. Plus it looks really cool!

here's a quick vid of me creating a SOLE CITY desktop background.


First let me introduce myself. My name is Tremain, aka Bone, and I have a love for Art, Music, Fashion, Kicks and anything creative.

After 25 years of dreaming about doing this I am finally taking that step. I don't know if I will change the world and I'm not sure how I would even if I tried. I do know that I want to bring original, high impact, top level quality fashion back into people's lives. I will create jobs that will help people to grow creatively and professionally and see them off when they move on to create their own success. I want to share my joy for life and art one garment at a time.

Your help will get me to the next step. I have put all I have into this business and all I have left is my creativity, experience and time. I need $50,000 to do what I want to do and not have to worry about living, but I will make it happen with $20,000. Since all I have is in this and all that's left is my desire to make it happen (will never die) and what I came into this world with your contributions will do more than just help me fund this they will help me to keep moving forward.

I need a minimum of $20,000 to bring ROKN Apparel to life. I know that a total of $50,000 is best, but I will make it work no matter what and with handwork, determination and a the help of good people the minimum can get me there.

What will I do with the funds?

  1. Order my first production run.
  2. Further Product Development.
  3. Upgrade my design, photography and video equipment. Allowing me to save money on promotion and production costs and put more money back into product development.
  4. Allow development of proper ecommerce site for worldwide ordering and shipping.
  5. Promotional expenses.
  6. Final Licensing (all copyrights and trademarks are finished, but there are a few other things I need to do.)
  7. Sustain a basic living and I can continue to put 100% into this dream, because that's the only way its going to come true.


In return for your help I am offering Top Brand Quality apparel at mid-level brand prices and I will continue to due this as long as I am alive. I believe in the best quality for your buck and that's what I'm giving. I'm also offering some very unique custom sneakers that you will not be able to get anywhere else. I will hand paint the sneakers myself using acrylic paint and bamboo brushes. I will seal the shoes so the design lasts for years to come.  And I can't wait to see all the happy people ROKN their O-Boy gear all over the world. I am so excited about putting smiles on your faces and being a part of making your day better. We all know that when we walk out the house feeling good about how we look we feel better about the day. That is what I want to bring to anyone and everyone who wears what I create.

If I do not reach my goal of $20,000 I will use the funds I received to further what I can. I will order some initial products and get samples and products out there by heading to New York and Tokyo for their respective fashion conferences. I will never give up on this. I am determined to create a place for the creatively determined people out there.

Maybe the O-Boy gear isn't your style. Rest assured that I have many designs all original and all ready to be put together for releases through the year. If you are not ready to contribute by taking advantage of the incentives please MAKE SOME NOISE for me. Tell people. Use the indiegogo share tools to share this for me. I have worked hard for this and will continue to do so, but no one can do it all alone. 

I NEED A HELPING HAND, VOICE OR ANYTHING ELSE YOU CAN GIVE.

Thank You for contributing, sharing or anything else you have done.

I will have regular updates on products and more.

Thanks again for stopping by...
story_txt:
The purpose of this campaign is to raise enough money for the first run of t-shirts, tank tops and caps of new american sportswear line. So if the goal is met this is basically a grand preorder event for the book, and as with other crowdfunding campaigns; if the goal isn't reached all the money will be refunded to everyone. In that case ROKN Apparel will have to stay in the dream status for a while and the world keeps on turning. But let's aim for the first run!


If you stumbled upon this campaign without knowing about ROKN Apparel beforehand, let me tell you a little about it. I started working on this line, because of a comic I'm creating. Yup, a comic. The comic is called SOLE CITY and it was created under my freelance graphics persona Rockin Dem Chucks Design. 

















I started posting images of the characters and people fell in love with the characters and started choosing favorites. Soon the requests for t-shirts came and I have always loved fashion, particularly american sportswear (t-shirts, ball caps and such). RDCD ROKN actually came from my design name, Rockin Dem Chucks. I just took out the "C" and the "I" because I have a fascination with four letters. Plus it looks really cool!
here's a quick vid of me creating a SOLE CITY desktop background.



First let me introduce myself. My name is Tremain, aka Bone, and I have a love for Art, Music, Fashion, Kicks and anything creative.
After 25 years of dreaming about doing this I am finally taking that step. I don't know if I will change the world and I'm not sure how I would even if I tried. I do know that I want to bring original, high impact, top level quality fashion back into people's lives. I will create jobs that will help people to grow creatively and professionally and see them off when they move on to create their own success. I want to share my joy for life and art one garment at a time.



Your help will get me to the next step. I have put all I have into this business and all I have left is my creativity, experience and time. I need $50,000 to do what I want to do and not have to worry about living, but I will make it happen with $20,000. Since all I have is in this and all that's left is my desire to make it happen (will never die) and what I came into this world with your contributions will do more than just help me fund this they will help me to keep moving forward.




I need a minimum of $20,000 to bring ROKN Apparel to life. I know that a total of $50,000 is best, but I will make it work no matter what and with handwork, determination and a the help of good people the minimum can get me there.



What will I do with the funds?


Order my first production run.
Further Product Development.
Upgrade my design, photography and video equipment. Allowing me to save money on promotion and production costs and put more money back into product development.
Allow development of proper ecommerce site for worldwide ordering and shipping.
Promotional expenses.
Final Licensing (all copyrights and trademarks are finished, but there are a few other things I need to do.)
Sustain a basic living and I can continue to put 100% into this dream, because that's the only way its going to come true.


In return for your help I am offering Top Brand Quality apparel at mid-level brand prices and I will continue to due this as long as I am alive. I believe in the best quality for your buck and that's what I'm giving. I'm also offering some very unique custom sneakers that you will not be able to get anywhere else. I will hand paint the sneakers myself using acrylic paint and bamboo brushes. I will seal the shoes so the design lasts for years to come.  And I can't wait to see all the happy people ROKN their O-Boy gear all over the world. I am so excited about putting smiles on your faces and being a part of making your day better. We all know that when we walk out the house feeling good about how we look we feel better about the day. That is what I want to bring to anyone and everyone who wears what I create.
If I do not reach my goal of $20,000 I will use the funds I received to further what I can. I will order some initial products and get samples and products out there by heading to New York and Tokyo for their respective fashion conferences. I will never give up on this. I am determined to create a place for the creatively determined people out there.


Maybe the O-Boy gear isn't your style. Rest assured that I have many designs all original and all ready to be put together for releases through the year. If you are not ready to contribute by taking advantage of the incentives please MAKE SOME NOISE for me. Tell people. Use the indiegogo share tools to share this for me. I have worked hard for this and will continue to do so, but no one can do it all alone. 
I NEED A HELPING HAND, VOICE OR ANYTHING ELSE YOU CAN GIVE.
Thank You for contributing, sharing or anything else you have done.
I will have regular updates on products and more.
Thanks again for stopping by...

story:
About Meat Factory Clothing

Meat Factory Clothing is a new lifestyle brand, which creates awareness of the difference, weirdness and uniqueness that lurks in all of us. It means that it’s designed for individuals who are not afraid to express their own provocative originality.

Meat Factory Clothing is specialized in T-shirt production based on creating limited collections in which each of them brings out different animal character in human skin.

Every design is printed in the quantity of 50 pieces in 2 colors (25 + 25). All T-shirts are marked with a specific number, which tells the customer how many T-shirts of the particular collection were made as well as which one he/ she can get. 

This is highly limited brand. It means, if you miss your chance now, you won't be able to get your favorite design later. We don't need to see our designs on everybody. We want to see them only on those individuals who are not scared to wear them.

But good news is that after our first collection is sold out, we will come with another one immediately. 

Our debutant collection is called “The Rabbit”. The aim of this collection is to introduce you the new original adventure that you will experience with the brand - Meat Factory Clothing.

Design no.1:   Meat The Rabbit

Design no.2:   Meat The Hip


Design no.3:   Meat The Carrot


Design no.1:   The Rabbit Logo

All Meat Factory designs are:

100% fresh - you won't find it anywhere else

100% meat free - suitable for vegetarians and animal lovers

100% cotton - light natural material 


Explore our store: http://meatfactoryclothing.bigcartel.com/

Facebook: http://goo.gl/tlnwFm 


How Can You Contribute?

Unfortunately, we do not have finances to start this adventure by ourselves.Therefore we need also your help whether through direct finance cooperation or through sharing our project with as many people as it is possible.

What You Will Get? 

Naturally, in return for your generosity we’ve prepared awesome rewards for you. You can check what you can get for your support in the perks section. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can’t contribute money, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. There are of course other ways e.g.you can spread our idea and ask your friends to get word out and make some noise about our campaign by using Indiegogo share tools.

We are very grateful to all of you!

story:
Wow. We're getting popular! You might have seen our team on:                 

   

These socks make serious steps toward solving poverty.
Help us order the first batch.

We've taken the best quality socks you've ever worn, lovingly crafted them in working conditions of the highest ethical standards, and matched each design in support of a different social cause. 

To get started, we need your help to order 6,000 pairs. In the process, we can feed 6,000 malnourished children, plant 60,000 trees, and contribute to getting clean water to 500,000 people in Nepal!! We'll be releasing photos and information on the impact you 're creating throughout the campaign.

 These socks provide three therapeutic food packets to malnourished children in Sub-Saharan Africa 

We're working to directly support Action Against Hunger's nutrition programs in Kenya, South Sudan, and the Democratic Republic of Congo. Pledge now and help us reach our goal of feeding 6,000 children! 


These socks plant 30 trees in rural Ghana. 

We're working with Trees for the Future to plant trees and teach agroforestry technologies to the women and children to develop income generation, provide material for fuel and food, and protect the environment. Pledge now and help us reach our goal of planting 60,000 trees!


These socks send engineers to equip schools in Nepal

In Nepal, contaminated water sources are keeping kids out of school - because of health problems like diarrhoea, because of the need to collect water instead of go to school and because of the lack of sanitation. 

Engineers Without Borders Australia is educating people on how to identify clean water and practice good hygiene - this greatly increases the health of communities and the number of children in primary schools. Pledge to send an engineer to Nepal, to help on a project that will provide clean water to 500,000 people in Nepal.


We believe the quality standard of the humble sock has been too low for too long. So we've spared no expense on manufacturing the best socks that can be made. 

They're made from 200 needle count, organic, fair trade cotton. So it's like wearing 1000 thread count sheets on your feet, all day. Who said changing the planet needs to be uncomfortable?

They're sweat resistant too, so you won't have to change your socks between the gym and the office.

Essentially - they're probably the best socks you've ever worn. And they change the world.

With your help, we aspire to be a company that considers social responsibility as the central motivator for everything we do, rather than a guilt-ridden afterthought. From the very beginning, we wanted to ensure our entire supply chain was in alignment with this principle.

Both our manufacturer and fabric supplier were chosen as much for their outstanding pursuit of ethical standards and social responsibility as for their quality of products. Although they have numerous awards for social and environmental responsibility and have been audited by the highest governing body of ethical supply chains, we'll be sending our own representative when our socks go into production to verify these claims. We'll be posting updates - want to come for the ride?

                                                                

Made in Fair Trade Conditions. Because they should be.

                                                                

Made from Organic Cotton. They're grown to the Global Organic Textile Standard.

                                                                

Our manufacturer is a member of the Ethical Trading Initiative and the Business Social Compliance Initiative.

                                                                

Manufactured to the Confidence in Textiles standard for harmful substances.


Our factory has custom-produced the samples shown in the video and are ready to manufacture as soon as we raise the order amount with your help. We're entrepreneurs with a track record and more than ready to make this movement a reality.

Projects of this type aren't new to us. Our team includes:

  • Dr. Hassan is a public health expert and qualified doctor. He's worked with the WHO across eHealth, infectious disease surveillance, Roma Healthcare, predicting what the world will be like in 2050 and planning how public health must respond. 
  • Prashant co-founded an NGO in Nepal with Hassan and a small team of young professionals. He has also worked in Risk Management for Fidelity Investments, and in startups with some well-known entrepreneurs including the founder of ESPN 360.
  • Adam is the marketing strategist and previous Director of our partner, Engineers Without Borders. He's worked with the Red Cross Blood Service, the Asian Development Bank and the Australian Government to tackle poverty head on. He's even spent a year working with community groups in the Philippines - helping women start businesses.

What's done already:
It's taken us nearly a year to get to this point. The ducks are all in a row and we're ready to go.

  • Sock Design: We've collaborated with fashion designers that have worked on international runway shows globally to narrow down hundreds of concepts to these three. And we're looking forward to working with you guys to create more! 
  • Manufacturer: We reviewed several manufacturers before settling. They've sent samples and prototypes as well as comprehensive proof of their ethical claims
  • Prototypes: The prototypes have arrived and were used in the video.
  • Color Confirmation: We've made a slight tweak to the environment sock and confirmed it with our manufacturer.
  • Partners: We love our partners! It took months of love and care to line up the right projects so your socks directly fight poverty. It's also worth noting that not all partners we approached were ready to work with us. 

What's Next:
Here's what you'll experience with us after the campaign.

  • The funds arrive (3 weeks): It takes some time for the funds to clear, but we'll be busy on the packaging in the meantime.
  • Packaging design: We'll use a standard packaging type for our first batch and share the design with you.
  • Confirm the order for 6000 pairs and pay the manufacturer.
  • Pre production proof (3 weeks): We'll get samples of all three socks with the yarns and embroidery and share the photos with you. We need to approve these before full production gets underway.
  • Wait for production (up to 90 days): It takes 90 days to manufacture this many socks. We'll be sending a representative to the factory to update you as we go
  • Sock arrive at Conscious Step HQ! Landing in early 2014
  • Postage (1 week): Off they go - we'll send them all around the world in a big send off.
  • Fund direct impact: We'll give our partner's their share of the profit at this point. We need to clear all our manufacturing and postage costs first.
  • Share the direct impact: We want to keep you up to date as your socks have impact all over the world.
  • New socks, new impact. This is only the beginning, because if you've got a cause, we've got a sock. Join us for something truly amazing! 


FAQ:

I'm new to crowdfunding. How does it work?

Crowd funding is the collective effort of individuals who pool their money to support efforts initiated by other people or organizations. Every project creator sets their project's funding goal and deadline. If people like the project, they can pledge money to make it happen.

What sizes are available?

For men, our socks are universal fit, and for women, our socks universally fit large feet. 

Can women wear these socks?

Who's going to stop you?

What are the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs)?

These are eight international development goals to combat poverty created by the UN in the year 2000, each with specific targets to be achieved by 2015. Check out our media page for more info on the MDGs .

What's the deal with the badge at the ankle?

These are special embroideries that represent the impact you've created and the cause you are supporting - they were inspired by the MDGs! We're beginning with hunger, education, and environment (MDG 1,2, and 7). We'll be adding more designs and more causes as we go on. 

Are the prices in US or AUD?

USD. (Could be a worse time though, right, Australia?)

Can I pick my design / cause for the Baby Steps package?

Yes, we will contact you for your preference once the campaign has ended.



Special thanks to the amazing contributions from:

  • Action Against Hunger
  • Trees For the Future
  • Engineers Without Borders, Australia and Katie Shozi
  • The indispensible intern team - Natasha, Elizabeth, Leon, and Japan
  • UNSW - New South Innovations and Joshua Flannery
  • LinkedIn and Rahul Mehta
  • Step Change Marketing and Jeff, Ash, Simon, Glenn and Dom
  • BlackCitrus VC - Pezh and Shannon
  • Social Enterprises Sydney and Tatjana Co
  • Indako
  • Bare Hill Designs and Sarah Hill 
  • Alex Patton - Sock Model
  • Natasha Boyle - Sock Admirer
  • Tim McGinley - Sock Model
  • Jacob and Jeremy Griffiths
  • Dave Katague - film maker. Excellent work. www.davekatague.com

Thank you for your support
