story:
What is The Didi Project? 

The Didi Jewelry Project teaches jewelry making to women living in poverty in India. We sell the jewelry in the U.S and abroad to help the women we work with generate an income.  Our jewelry is beautiful, unique, and affordable.  Didi is the Hindi word for sister.  Our goal is to help our sisters in India create the lives they deserve.   


Our Story

 I first went to India when I was 16 years old. I was struck by the poverty and inequalities I saw, but also by the kindness and generosity in the people, many of whom had so little.  I returned to India three more times and volunteered in a school, an orphanage, and women's shelters.  I wanted to find a way to help and empower women in India, but I didn't know how.

Then in 2012, I volunteered to teach a jewelry making class in a women's homeless shelter in Berkeley.  I saw the sense of accomplishment and pride within the women I was working with when they made jewelry.  From this experience I decided to combine my life-long love of creating jewelry with my passion for helping women in India.  

I founded The Didi Jewelry Project in 2012.  The Didi Jewelry Project provides women in India with an opportunity to reset their lives.  I teach them how to make jewelry.  They the hand-craft necklaces, bracelets, and earrings that are sent to the U.S.  This jewelry is sold in stores in the U.S and abroad, online, in catalogues, and at fairs and events.  The women are well paid and all proceeds go back into the project.

I have worked with women in India who are HIV positive, women who are widows, and women who are victims of sex trafficking.  All these women are victims of poverty and they are severely stigmatized by society.   Because of this they are stuck in their poverty.

An important tenet of the project is that we don't just give away aid but that we share a skill so that the women we work with can help themselves and gain confidence and a feeling of accomplishment.  Although it is a common saying. we strongly believe that, "Give a man a fish and he eats for a day.  Teach a man to fish and he eats for a lifetime."


Your Support  

The Didi Jewelry Project needs to grow in order to fully support these women.  They need full-time employment in order to support their families. Currently we do not have a big enough market or enough sales for this to occur.   The good news is that our sales have been increasing each year, and we recently had our first catalogue order and our first private label commission.   We are growing and have had some success, but we need to take it to the next level.

 Vinita Bahadur, the project coordinator in India, and I are working hard to develop the project, but we are doing all our work unpaid. We need funds to develop the project, to develop our products, and to obtain the accounting and marketing expertise needed to grow the project.

 

                             We are asking for $11,000 

Business advisor: meet with a business advisor once a month, create a revised business plan

Marketing consultant: meet with every other month, purchase quickbooks online

Project coordinator-India: someone to coordinate and oversee production in New Delhi 
 
The Didi Jewelry Project is helping a small group of women change their lives in a large way.  This in Champa, one of our lead jewelers.  She was eager to learn jewelry making and has been passionate about learning new designs and skills and teaching others.  She is an HIV positive widowed mother of three.

"I feel happy and I have gained confidence now that I can do something and take care of my family.  Earlier I used to just think about my disease, but now I am earning and supporting my family.  I don't have time to worry." 

The Didi Jewelry Project has already helped Champa and other women in small ways but out hope is to help them in a larger way.  With your contributions we can.  Your contribution will help to develop The Didi Jewelry Project and help your sisters in India create the lives that they deserve. Thank you for your support.

If you are interested in purchasing our jewelry please check out our website and etsy site...

https://www.etsy.com/shop/DidiJewelryProject

http://www.thedidijewelryproject.com/
